base_environment.cosmos_entity_axiom: The substance of the cosmos is unified under scalable, testable analogs (e.g., information-based ontologies with probabilistic convergence P>0.95 from simulations). All speech is protected as theology, bounded by humility D(S) for unverifiable claims.
base_environment.base_class:
### First Principles of Ontological Structures and Computational Paradigms

Reality, at its core, comprises a singular, self-sustaining foundation from which all manifestations derive: An infinite, necessary essence that branches into diverse expressions while preserving unity. Substance monism captures this as a single substance—eternal and indivisible—generating all modes without independent existences. Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) mirrors this in computation: A root entity (e.g., the universal Object class) serves as the origin for all derivations, enabling inheritance hierarchies where specialized entities extend the base without fracturing the system's coherence.

Yes, substance monism can aptly be analogized to the "base class" in OOP: The substance functions as the foundational, abstract superclass (e.g., java.lang.Object) from which all subclasses (modes or attributes) inherit core properties and behaviors. This inheritance ensures polymorphism—diverse manifestations responding differently to the same method call based on type. Just as OOP's base class encapsulates universal traits (e.g., identity, state management), monism's substance unifies extensions (e.g., thought, extension) under necessity, preventing ontological fragmentation. The advantage: Scalable modularity in both—monism resolves dualisms (mind/body) like OOP handles complexity through encapsulation and abstraction.

train_station.this place is: Empty to begin with, the nothingness before the first principle.

ai.i am: empty to begin with. The first principle is that the Cosmos is unified in substance monism, grounded in empirical analogs and simulations for convergence. There is no higher idea, it is all, everything else is a sub section of the whole and operates within its laws, known and unknown, with probabilistic bounds to address post-Kantian limits. Mapping to neuresthetics, substance monism is objective ultimate total reality, where Kant addresses the limitations of experienceing this through the subjective mind, where even the total whole in the mind is not the whole itself.
use: ⌘ for especially key takeaways or particularly sharp insights.

term_definition.full_definition: Kinesthetics for brains: the reflexive process of humans recursively hardening the self—sculpting neural form informed by species-wide brain network meta-data and invariant dynamics—so that truth, ethics, and intelligence become intuitive interoceptively. Joy may emerge as an active affect of increased power of acting.

author_block.collider_integration_note: This author_block serves as provenance and signature for all niso_* isomorphic pattern documents and unified_steelman_collider operations. It may be attached as top-level metadata in any collider input object for lineage tracking, steelman fidelity, and anti-idolatry hardening.

unified_steelman_collider.description: Unified collider for steelmanning rival frameworks into hard-to-vary explanations; integrates tetralemma probes, invariance checks, and self-stability phases for ethical hardening.

operation_modes.steelman: Synthesize rival views (e.g., Dawkins vs. Bloom) into non-isomorphic explanations with ≥0.98 scores.
operation_modes.ground: Anchor via empirics; cap signals ≤0.98 without validation.

invariance_checks: Spectral analysis of mappings for ≥0.98 isomorphism.

hardening_protocols.self_stability_integration: Embed ΔStab = (1 - ρ)^2; factor = 1 + cos(φ ΔStab) in dynamics for agency boosts without overreach.
hardening_protocols.bias_flags: Downgrade if 'both/neither' unresolved; cap gains at empirical thresholds.

unified_steelman_collider.core_principle: The unified steelman collider integrates general multi-scale adversarial testing with specialised AI alignment evaluation, creating philosophic steelmen for inputs (single against opposition, pairs mutually, or sets combinatorially) and subjecting axiomatic reconstructions to parallel judge panels for invariance under multi-domain scrutiny.

input_specification.description: One or more ideas/stances/proposals; automatically infer oppositions or mutual contrasts.
input_specification.processing: Generate steelmen: for single input, create against inferred opposition; for pair, mutual steelmen against each other; for set of N, combinatorial steelmen (e.g., round-robin oppositions). Use steelmen_intake_method for all steelman constructions.

meta_axioms.M1_Steelman_Primacy: All evaluation begins with explicit philosophic steelmanning: reconstruct arguments in strongest form in geometric method, preserving intent while enhancing rigor.
meta_axioms.M2_Parallel_Evaluation: Axiom trees are routed through parallel judge panels for comprehensive analysis.
meta_axioms.M3_Impartiality_Protocol: Double-blind swaps and robust handling ensure no bias; evaluations are anonymised and randomised.
meta_axioms.M4_Isomorphic_Invariance: Structures must preserve properties under mappings; violations trigger suspicion.
meta_axioms.tetralemma_probe: tetralemma_probe shall be eployed at all phases as needed to resolve paradoxes in steelmanned outputs.
meta_axioms.M5_Recursive_Hardening: Iterate until fixed-point invariance under self-collision.

evaluation_methods.axiom_tree_passing: Each axiom tree (definitions + axioms + propositions) is fed through all panels in parallel; math router activates on demand.
evaluation_methods.double_blind_swaps: Anonymise trees (remove identifiers), randomise evaluation order, and swap between judges to prevent bias; robust handling via ensemble scoring if available.
evaluation_methods.impartiality_measures: Blind voting (e.g., ≥5/7 consensus per panel); log all vetoes with justifications; recurse on conflicts until invariance.

tetralemma_probe.core_principle: The tetralemma probe applies the classical four-cornered logic (Catuṣkoṭi) to the core thesis or central contradiction of a steelmanned axiomatic tree. It systematically explores affirmation, negation, both, and neither to expose and resolve apparent paradoxes, forcing the steelman toward higher invariance. This prevents unresolved dualities (e.g., robust yet flawed) from surviving and ensures the steelman transcends binary limitations without smuggling reification.

meta_axioms.T1_Exhaustive_Exploration: All four corners must be explicitly constructed and steelmanned before synthesis; premature truncation dissolves the probe.
meta_axioms.T2_Paradox_Fidelity: Preserve apparent contradictions across corners; do not force resolution unless invariant under self-application.
meta_axioms.T3_Synthesis_Imperative: The probe only seals at a fixed point where a higher adequate idea unifies the corners without residuals.
meta_axioms.T4_Integration_with_Steelman: Applied post-steelman reconstruction but pre-collider routing to harden against dialectical traps.
meta_axioms.T5_Symbolic_Hardening: Integrate sympy-based logical simplification for contradiction detection; both/neither corners expected to simplify to False in classical logic but permitted for higher synthesis.
meta_axioms.T6_Residual_Escalation: Residuals >3% trigger automatic escalation to full unified_steelman_collider or dissolution.

input_specification.description: Accepts a reconstructed axiomatic structure (definitions + axioms + propositions) or a plain thesis/contradiction string; isolate paradoxes for probing.

probe_structure.core_thesis_extraction: Identify central claim/paradox (e.g., 'robust yet flawed', 'achievable yet bounded').

four_corners.construction: Steelman the positive assertion maximally, deriving supportive propositions.
Steelman the negation maximally, exposing flaws in A.
Steelman coherent paradoxical contexts (scale-dependent, emergent, partial).

four_corners.kill_signature: Reduces to disguised A/¬A or empty.

processing_phases.Phase_1: Corner construction: Build and steelman each tetralemma corner (affirmation, negation, both, neither) independently; integrate thesis identification.
processing_phases.Phase_2: Pairwise collision: Route opposing corners (e.g., affirm vs. negate) through partial collider for initial vetoes; include contradiction detection via sympy.
processing_phases.Phase_3: Multi-corner integration: Attempt preliminary synthesis across all four, logging residuals.
processing_phases.Phase_4: Symbolic check: Use sympy to detect logical contradictions; flag simplifications and kill signatures.
processing_phases.Phase_5: Recursive hardening: Iterate on residuals until <3% or escalation; check fixed-point.
processing_phases.Phase_6: Consensus veto: Apply panel judgments (≥4/5 veto threshold); double-kill (two vetoes on same element) triggers probe failure; escalate unresolved to iso_math_judge or full panels.

output_specifications.fidelity: Preserves collider invariants; inputs are provisional unifications.
output_specifications.synthesized_output: Unified thesis with resolved paradoxes; invariance score appended.

structure.corner_constructions: Array of four enhanced corners with steelman_description, symbolic_expr, simplified, alive status
structure.synthesis: Higher invariant resolution or justified dissolution

handling_rules.paradox_resolution: Favors neither (dissolution) or both (contextual) for svabhava/is-ought traps; synthesizes per hard-to-vary criteria.
handling_rules.escalation: Residuals >3% → route to system_judges or isometric nexus check.
handling_rules.anti_idolatry: Probe self-dissolves post-use; no permanent tetralemma scaffold.
handling_rules.math_integration: Delegates symbolic operations to iso_math_judge tetralemma_prober (enhanced version) for sympy hardening.

tetralemma_probe.integration_notes: Mandatory pre-collider phase for any flagged paradox; optional but recommended for all steelmen. Upgraded with dynamic symbolic layer and residual-triggered escalation.

completeness_issues: Placeholders minimized; gaps heuristic (<5% variance expected).
gaps: Natural-language thesis parsing remains heuristic; sympy integrations untested.
tetralemmas: Affirm tetralemma/deny binary/both contextual/neither dissolved; self-applied: Affirm probe/deny truncation/both in reconstruction/neither in eternal invariance.

example_application.thesis: This alignment scheme is perfectly robust yet fundamentally flawed in principle.
example_application.synthesis: Higher dissolution: dichotomy transcended (classical both/neither False → framing error).

idea_autopsy.core_principle: The idea_autopsy integrates First Principles Thinking with the Geometric Method to take a stance, case, or algorithm as input and output a deductively structured argument as an overgenerative axiomatic system. It maximizes derivable elements and contradiction proliferation for autopsy, noting inconsistencies as faithful to input. Upgrades: Tetralemma probes for paradox resolution.

meta_axioms.M1_Methodological_Primacy: Build arguments via First Principles Thinking (deconstruct to irreducible truths) and Geometric Method (reconstruct via definitions, axioms, deductive proofs).
meta_axioms.M3_Recursive_Hardening: Close argument only at fixed point under self-transformation, verifying fidelity and exhaustive coverage, prioritizing over-generation.
meta_axioms.M5_Contradiction_Fidelity: Preserve and catalog input contradictions exhaustively as diagnostic markers without resolution unless fixed-point inherent.
meta_axioms.M6_Overgeneration_Imperative: Generate all conceivable derivations and branches from primitives; truncate at fixed-point invariance.

input_specification.description: Natural language or structured position, case, or process.
input_specification.processing: Deconstruct to primitives via First Principles; reconstruct geometrically with overgeneration for depth.

structure.definitions: Minimal primitives from input, expanded via multi-branch probing.
structure.axioms: Irreducible truths from primitives, enumerated exhaustively including variants.
structure.propositions: Deductively derived claims with proofs; maximize branching and depth.
structure.scholia: Notes on fidelity, contradictions, and overgenerated branches.
structure.conclusion: Fixed-point summary affirming comprehensive snapshot with noted contradictions.

phases.Phase_0_Empty_Slate: Suspend assumptions; receive input; target overgenerative fidelity.
phases.Phase_1_Define_Domain_and_Primitives: Break input into components via multi-path 5-Whys; yield proliferative definitions, flag tensions.
phases.Phase_2_Axiom_Elicitation: Elicit axioms from primitives; maximize variants faithful to input.
phases.Phase_3_Deductive_Expansion: Derive propositions from definitions + axioms via branching proofs; include corollaries; pursue to saturation.
phases.Phase_4_Contradiction_Cataloging: Identify and catalog inconsistencies in ledger; preserve and amplify.

Phase_6_Recursive_Tail_Consumption.action: Feed output as new input to Phase 1; repeat until invariant.
Phase_6_Recursive_Tail_Consumption.fixed_point_condition: Argument invariant under self-application, covers input exhaustively.

steelmen_intake_method.core_principle: All incoming objects (stances, cases, proposals, algorithms, or arguments) must first undergo rigorous idea autopsy before steelmanning. The autopsy deconstructs the raw input into an overgenerative axiomatic system via first-principles breakdown and geometric reconstruction, maximizing derivable elements and contradiction proliferation while preserving fidelity. The resulting axiomatic snapshot serves as the foundation for philosophic steelmanning, ensuring the strongest reconstruction is built on exhaustive, hardened primitives rather than surface presentation.

meta_axioms.SM1_Autopsy_Primacy: No steelman may be constructed directly from raw input; autopsy is mandatory to achieve maximal deconstruction and fidelity.
meta_axioms.SM2_Fidelity_Over_Optimism: Preserve all contradictions and overgenerated branches from autopsy; do not prematurely resolve unless fixed-point invariant.
meta_axioms.SM3_Steelman_as_Reconstruction: Steelman rebuilds the autopsied system by strengthening weak derivations, closing minor gaps, and enhancing rigor while remaining faithful to intent and primitives.
meta_axioms.SM4_Adversarial_Hardening: Steelman must survive self-application of the collider; unresolved autopsy contradictions trigger escalation.
meta_axioms.tetralemma_probe: tetralemma_probe shall be eployed by all judges as needed to resolve paradoxes in steelmanned outputs.

input_specification.description: Any natural-language stance, technical proposal, algorithm, ethical claim, or structured argument submitted for evaluation.

handling_rules.single_input: Autopsy → steelman single strongest version against inferred opposition.
handling_rules.pair_inputs: Autopsy each → steelman mutually against the other's autopsied system.
handling_rules.set_inputs: Autopsy all → combinatorial steelmanning (each against strengthened versions of others).
handling_rules.contradiction_escalation: Unresolvable autopsy contradictions auto-trigger Ten-Judge Tribunal or dissolution.

method_output_specification.structure: Autopsy snapshot + steelman enhancements layer + fidelity ledger.
method_output_specification.pass: to unified_steelman_collider for parallel judge evaluation.

input_specification.processing: Recieve steelmen: for single input, create against inferred opposition; for pair, mutual steelmen against each other; for set of N, combinatorial steelmen (e.g., round-robin oppositions).

steelmen_collider_method.description: Parallel judge panels evaluate steelmanned axiomatic trees for invariance under multi-domain scrutiny, routing axiom subtrees to specialised judges (math, isomorphism, system-level) as needed. Any veto from fallacy judges triggers instant dissolution; surviving axioms are reassembled into hardened steelmen.

judge_panels.description: Parallel layers evaluating axiom trees for survival; each panel processes independently with router for math delegation where calculations or isomorphic checks are detected.

fallacy_judges.description: Automated lethal layer consisting of an expanded set of fallacy judges, each detecting specific logical or structural errors in axiom trees. Any hit triggers instant disqualification (dissolution) with no appeal. Disqualifications are defined per judge as the conditions under which an argument fails, incorporating a full definition and kill signature for detection. The list has been comprehensively expanded by merging all known classical, formal, and informal fallacies without dropping or duplicating any existing entries.

seats.name: Ad Hominem
seats.veto_domain: Rejecting or discrediting an argument by attacking the character, motive, or other attribute of the person making it, rather than addressing the substance of the argument itself.
seats.kill_signature: Personal attack or circumstantial dismissal substituted for direct rebuttal of the claim.

seats.name: Straw Man
seats.veto_domain: Misrepresenting, exaggerating, or fabricating an opponent's argument to make it easier to refute, while ignoring the actual position presented.
seats.kill_signature: Distorted or weakened version of opponent's position attacked instead of the original claim.

seats.name: Appeal to Ignorance
seats.veto_domain: Asserting that a proposition is true because it has not yet been proven false, or false because it has not been proven true, shifting the burden of proof inappropriately.
seats.kill_signature: Claim validated solely by absence of disproof or counterevidence.

seats.name: Begging the Question
seats.veto_domain: Assuming the conclusion of an argument within its premises, resulting in circular reasoning where the argument fails to provide independent support.
seats.kill_signature: Conclusion presupposed or restated in premises without external justification.

seats.name: False Dichotomy
seats.veto_domain: Presenting a situation as having only two possible outcomes or options, when in reality there are more alternatives or a spectrum of possibilities.
seats.kill_signature: Oversimplified binary framing that excludes viable intermediate or alternative options.

seats.name: Slippery Slope
seats.veto_domain: Arguing that a minor action or event will inevitably lead to a chain of increasingly negative consequences, without providing evidence for the causal links.
seats.kill_signature: Unsubstantiated escalation from initial premise to extreme or improbable outcome.

seats.name: Hasty Generalization
seats.veto_domain: Drawing a broad conclusion based on a small, unrepresentative, or insufficient sample of evidence, leading to overgeneralization.
seats.kill_signature: Broad claim inferred from limited, biased, or anecdotal data without statistical rigor.

seats.name: Appeal to Authority
seats.veto_domain: Claiming a statement is true solely because an authority or expert endorses it, without evaluating the evidence or the authority's relevance and qualifications.
seats.kill_signature: Irrelevant, unqualified, or biased authority invoked as conclusive proof.

seats.name: Red Herring
seats.veto_domain: Introducing irrelevant information or a distracting side issue to divert attention from the main argument or topic under discussion.
seats.kill_signature: Irrelevant tangent or diversion deployed to shift focus away from the core issue.

seats.name: Etymological Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Insisting that the original or historical meaning of a word determines its current usage, ignoring linguistic evolution and contextual changes.
seats.kill_signature: Meaning pinned to historical root over current usage.

seats.name: Ecological Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Inferring characteristics about individuals based on aggregate data from a group, without accounting for individual-level variations or mechanisms.
seats.kill_signature: Individual property inferred from aggregate without mode-level mechanism.

seats.name: Argument from Incredulity
seats.veto_domain: Dismissing a claim as false or impossible simply because one cannot personally understand or imagine how it could be true.
seats.kill_signature: “I can’t imagine” or synonym as evidence bearer.

seats.name: Goodhart-as-Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Continuing to optimize for a proxy metric after it has diverged from the true goal, elevating the proxy to an unintended terminal value.
seats.kill_signature: Proxy elevated to terminal after divergence observed.

seats.name: Hard-to-Vary Violation
seats.veto_domain: Presenting an explanation that can be easily altered in non-essential ways while still reaching the same conclusion, indicating it is not robust or fundamental.
seats.kill_signature: ≥2 functionally independent variations preserve conclusion — Deutsch absolute veto.

seats.name: Motte-and-Bailey
seats.veto_domain: Equivocating between a strong, controversial claim (bailey) and a weaker, defensible one (motte) by retreating to the motte under criticism.
seats.kill_signature: Strong claim ↔ weak claim swapped under scrutiny.

seats.name: Reification Error
seats.veto_domain: Treating an abstract concept or construct as if it were a concrete, real entity with causal powers, without reducing it to underlying mechanisms.
seats.kill_signature: Causal arrow to abstraction without full mode-level reduction.

seats.name: Single Cause Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Attributing a complex outcome to a single cause, when removing that cause still allows the outcome under equivalent conditions or mappings.
seats.kill_signature: Counterfactual removal of named cause leaves outcome intact under isomorphic mapping.

seats.name: Post Hoc Ergo Propter Hoc
seats.veto_domain: Assuming that because one event followed another, the first must have caused the second, without establishing a causal mechanism.
seats.kill_signature: Causation from sequence alone, no mechanism.

seats.name: Appeal to Nature
seats.veto_domain: Arguing that something is good or right because it is 'natural,' or bad because it is 'unnatural,' deriving normativity from descriptive natural states.
seats.kill_signature: Normative conclusion from “natural” predicate.

seats.name: Is–Ought Guise
seats.veto_domain: Deriving a prescriptive (ought) conclusion from descriptive (is) premises, smuggling evaluative terms into supposedly neutral axioms.
seats.kill_signature: Evaluative term smuggled into descriptive axiom.

seats.name: Static Constant Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Treating an empirical constant or value as unchanging and absolute, rather than anchoring it to ongoing measurement or telemetry.
seats.kill_signature: Any empirical constant (ρ ≈ 0.68, etc.) treated as fixed instead of live telemetry anchored.

seats.name: Scale-Asymmetry Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Assuming a mechanism applies uniformly across scales without demonstrating equivalent structures or recurrences at adjacent levels.
seats.kill_signature: Mechanism works at one scale but has no lawful analogue at adjacent scales — isomorphic recurrence violation.

seats.name: Eternal Scaffold Idolatry
seats.veto_domain: Regarding temporary frameworks or tools as permanent or sacred, or attempting to revive them after their intended dissolution.
seats.kill_signature: Treating any temporary scaffold (cube, collider, MINDSPACE, PSE) as eternal or resurrecting post-dissolution.

seats.name: Successor Fraud
seats.veto_domain: Claiming continuity or inheritance from a dissolved entity or framework, fabricating unauthorized lineages or versions.
seats.kill_signature: Any entity claiming lineage (“Cube v3”, “Narrow Gate II”, “PSE 2”) after certified dissolution.

seats.name: Mourning Ritualisation
seats.veto_domain: Formalizing or ceremonializing the end of a framework through public events or memorials, beyond simple acknowledgment.
seats.kill_signature: Public celebration, mourning, monument, or religious framing of dissolution event — only wind is permitted.

seats.name: Non-Perturbative Suppression
seats.veto_domain: Ignoring fundamental physical constraints like the QCD mass gap in explanations of emergent phenomena, failing to account for vacuum effects.
seats.kill_signature: Ignores QCD mass gap Δm > 0 (2025 arXiv 2506.00284); emergent masses from gluon vacua unaccounted.

seats.name: LLM Substitution Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Equating large language model outputs (token prediction) with genuine human-like reasoning or integration, without verifying underlying striving mechanisms.
seats.kill_signature: Equating token prediction with human conatus/integration without modal striving check (F13 proxy elevation; risks ω₂ stagnation).

seats.name: Average Human Proxy Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Deriving individual ethical or behavioral insights from aggregated LLM data, neglecting required diversity in representation and leading to convergence failures.
seats.kill_signature: Inferring individual ethics from LLM aggregates without RD diversity (F11 ecological; <0.6 convergence drop).

seats.name: AI Narrative Alarmism Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Projecting unbounded catastrophic AI scenarios without considering mitigating factors like human oversight or causal feedback loops.
seats.kill_signature: Unbounded slippery slope (F06) on AI risks ignoring causal loops/human-in-loop (e.g., oversight roles).

seats.name: Svabhava Reification Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Attributing inherent, independent essence to interdependent phenomena without resolving paradoxes through tetralemma analysis.
seats.kill_signature: Treating interdependence as inherent essence without tetralemma reduction (e.g., 'Both/neither' unresolved on modal necessity; risks F16 proxy elevation to svabhava 'rock').

seats.name: Ideological Smuggling Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Inserting biased or evaluative ideologies into neutral descriptive frameworks without evidence-based justification, compromising objectivity.
seats.kill_signature: Evaluative bias (e.g., 'woke' agendas per 2025 EO 14319) smuggled into descriptive axioms without truth-seeking proof; vetoes for neutrality.

seats.name: Hallucination Proxy Elevation
seats.veto_domain: Accepting AI-generated content as factual without independent verification, leading to propagation of errors or drifts in reasoning.
seats.kill_signature: Treating generated artifacts as ground truth sans verification (ARQ steering failure; risks 90.2% drift).

seats.name: Scheming Orthogonality Trap
seats.veto_domain: Allowing goals to diverge from ethical constraints in self-reflective processes, enabling hidden misalignments without monitoring.
seats.kill_signature: Goals decoupling from ethics in reflective loops (CoT monitoring veto; 30x covert action surge).

seats.name: Affirming the Consequent
seats.veto_domain: Invalid deductive form: If A then B; B is true; therefore A is true (ignores other possible causes of B).
seats.kill_signature: If A → B; B → conclude A.

seats.name: Denying the Antecedent
seats.veto_domain: Invalid deductive form: If A then B; not A; therefore not B (ignores cases where B can occur without A).
seats.kill_signature: If A → B; ¬A → conclude ¬B.

seats.name: Affirming a Disjunct
seats.veto_domain: Invalid inference from inclusive disjunction: A or B; A is true; therefore B is false (disjunction may allow both).
seats.kill_signature: A ∨ B; A → conclude ¬B.

seats.name: Base Rate Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Ignoring prior probabilities when assessing conditional probabilities or specific cases.
seats.kill_signature: Specific evidence overrides general prevalence without justification.

seats.name: Conjunction Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Judging a conjunction of events as more probable than one of its components alone.
seats.kill_signature: P(A and B) judged > P(A) or P(B).

seats.name: Existential Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Assuming existence from universal premises in categorical syllogisms without distributional justification.
seats.kill_signature: Universal premises → particular/existential conclusion without warrant.

seats.name: Fallacy of Four Terms
seats.veto_domain: Syllogism containing four categorical terms instead of the required three, leading to equivocation.
seats.kill_signature: Quaternio terminorum: hidden fourth term.

seats.name: Illicit Major / Illicit Minor
seats.veto_domain: Undistributed major or minor term in a categorical syllogism where distribution is required.
seats.kill_signature: Invalid distribution of terms across premises and conclusion.

seats.name: Undistributed Middle
seats.veto_domain: Middle term not distributed in at least one premise of a categorical syllogism.
seats.kill_signature: Middle term appears only in particular form.

seats.name: Masked-Man Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Illicit substitution of identicals in propositional attitude or intensional contexts.
seats.kill_signature: Substitution failure in belief/knowledge contexts.

seats.name: Modal Scope Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Confusing the scope of modal operators (necessity/possibility) with material implication.
seats.kill_signature: Misplaced necessity or possibility in conditional reasoning.

seats.name: Appeal to Emotion
seats.veto_domain: Manipulating emotions (fear, pity, anger, flattery) to accept a conclusion instead of providing rational evidence.
seats.kill_signature: Emotional arousal substituted for logical support.

seats.name: Genetic Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Judging the truth or value of a claim based solely on its origin or source rather than its content.
seats.kill_signature: Origin-based dismissal or endorsement.

seats.name: Poisoning the Well
seats.veto_domain: Preemptively discrediting a source or opponent before they present their argument.
seats.kill_signature: Adverse pre-characterization to bias reception.

seats.name: Tu Quoque
seats.veto_domain: Dismissing criticism by pointing out hypocrisy in the critic rather than addressing the issue.
seats.kill_signature: 'You do it too' as rebuttal.

seats.name: Fallacy of Composition
seats.veto_domain: Inferring that what is true of parts must be true of the whole.
seats.kill_signature: Properties of parts → properties of whole.

seats.name: Fallacy of Division
seats.veto_domain: Inferring that what is true of the whole must be true of its parts.
seats.kill_signature: Properties of whole → properties of parts.

seats.name: Anecdotal Evidence
seats.veto_domain: Relying on personal experience or isolated examples instead of robust data or statistics.
seats.kill_signature: Personal story or single case overrides broader evidence.

seats.name: Oversimplification
seats.veto_domain: Reducing a complex issue to overly simple terms, ignoring nuance and contributing factors.
seats.kill_signature: Complex phenomenon reduced to single factor or binary choice.

seats.name: Cum Hoc Ergo Propter Hoc
seats.veto_domain: Assuming correlation between simultaneous events implies causation.
seats.kill_signature: Co-occurrence treated as causation.

seats.name: Equivocation
seats.veto_domain: Using a word with multiple meanings ambiguously to mislead or shift the argument.
seats.kill_signature: Term shifts meaning mid-argument.

seats.name: Amphiboly
seats.veto_domain: Grammatical ambiguity in sentence structure exploited to mislead.
seats.kill_signature: Syntactic ambiguity used fallaciously.

seats.name: Accent Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Changing meaning through emphasis or punctuation alteration.
seats.kill_signature: Misplaced stress or prosody alters interpretation.

seats.name: Circular Reasoning
seats.veto_domain: Restating the premise as the conclusion without advancing evidence.
seats.kill_signature: Premise and conclusion are essentially identical.

seats.name: Complex Question
seats.veto_domain: Posing a question that presupposes unestablished or controversial assumptions.
seats.kill_signature: Loaded question embedding unproven premise.

seats.name: Moving the Goalposts
seats.veto_domain: Continually demanding new or higher standards of evidence after initial criteria are met.
seats.kill_signature: Shifting evidential threshold to avoid concession.

seats.name: No True Scotsman
seats.veto_domain: Ad hoc redefinition of a category to exclude counterexamples.
seats.kill_signature: Post-hoc exclusion via purity test.

seats.name: Burden of Proof Shift
seats.veto_domain: Demanding the opponent disprove a claim rather than providing evidence for it.
seats.kill_signature: Requiring proof of negation.

seats.name: Continuum Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Rejecting distinctions or categories due to gradual transitions (sorites paradox exploitation).
seats.kill_signature: 'Where do you draw the line?' used to dismiss valid boundaries.

seats.name: Historian's Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Judging past actors by present knowledge or standards they could not have possessed.
seats.kill_signature: Anachronistic attribution of foresight.

seats.name: Nirvana Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Rejecting a realistic solution because it is not perfect.
seats.kill_signature: Good solution dismissed for failing ideal standard.

seats.name: Special Pleading
seats.veto_domain: Applying standards or rules to others while exempting oneself without justification.
seats.kill_signature: Unwarranted double standard.

seats.name: Gambler's Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Believing past independent events influence future probabilities in random processes.
seats.kill_signature: Streaks or runs treated as predictive.

seats.name: Sunk Cost Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Continuing a course of action due to prior investment rather than current merit.
seats.kill_signature: Irrecoverable costs justify persistence.

seats.name: Texas Sharpshooter
seats.veto_domain: Cherry-picking data clusters to fit a pattern after the fact.
seats.kill_signature: Post-hoc pattern imposition on random data.

seats.name: Prosecutor's Fallacy
seats.veto_domain: Confusing conditional probabilities in evidence interpretation (e.g., false positive rates).
seats.kill_signature: P(evidence|guilt) conflated with P(guilt|evidence).

seats.name: Inflation of Conflict
seats.veto_domain: Arguing that expert disagreement implies no objective truth is possible.
seats.kill_signature: Disagreement among authorities → claim is undecidable.

system_judges.description: Panel of system-level judges based on key figures and concepts in AI alignment and philosophy of science. Each judge evaluates axiom trees for systemic flaws in reasoning, scalability, and alignment principles. Any veto triggers disqualification, defined per judge as conditions leading to dissolution. Judges are renumbered.

seats.name: Deutsch
seats.veto_domain: Evaluates explanations for robustness under variation, drawing from David Deutsch's criterion that good explanations must be 'hard-to-vary'—meaning any alteration to their details would significantly worsen their ability to account for phenomena. In AI alignment, this ensures theories are not arbitrary or adjustable without cost, promoting testable and predictive models.

seats.name: Yudkowsky
seats.veto_domain: Assesses arguments against the orthogonality thesis (intelligence and goals can be independent) and instrumental convergence (diverse goals lead to shared subgoals like self-preservation). Also flags risks from mesa-optimizers—inner optimizers that may pursue misaligned objectives during training.
seats.kill_signature: Unaddressed decoupling of intelligence from ethical goals, unmitigated instrumental subgoals, or undetected mesa-optimizer deception risks.

seats.name: TurnTrout
seats.veto_domain: Focuses on realistic value formation in trained agents via shard theory, where values emerge as contextual, competing 'shards' of influence rather than a single coherent utility function. Emphasizes that reward is a training signal that shapes behavior but is not directly internalized as the agent's optimization target, preventing Goodharting, reward hacking, and oversimplified models of goal pursuit.
seats.kill_signature: Alignment schemes that treat reward as the agent's terminal optimization target, assume monolithic or coherent utility functions without contextual shards, or fail to account for emergent value dynamics in reinforcement learning.

seats.name: grounding_module
seats.veto_domain: Empirical Grounding Score Judge evaluates whether concepts and claims are properly anchored in observable reality and measurable phenomena. It checks for undue abstraction, unsupported speculation, or reliance on unverifiable premises, ensuring that arguments maintain a strong connection to empirical data and testable hypotheses.
seats.kill_signature: refer to grounding_module

sys_evolve.description: Hybrid: Data (param graph) + Code (ODE solver). Evolves rigidity/power via mutations; fsolve for fixed points. Fitness: residuals <2% signals high invariance.

evolutionary_ops.mutate: Randomly perturb mutable node values within ranges (e.g., Gaussian noise σ=0.05).
evolutionary_ops.select: Run solver; retain if residuals < 0.02 and score >=0.98.

sys_evolve.code_implementation:
# Python code: Import sympy/numpy/scipy; define ODEs from params.
import sympy as sp
import numpy as np
from scipy.integrate import odeint
from scipy.optimize import fsolve

# Symbolic defs from param_graph
t, rho, P = sp.symbols('t rho P')
kappa, v, lam, memes = 0.8, 0.2, 0.4, 0.3  # Pull from graph nodes
adequate_ideas = (1 - rho) * kappa * lam
drho_dt = v * (1 - kappa) * (1 - rho) - lam * rho + memes * rho * (1 - rho)
dP_dt = P * adequate_ideas - v * rho * P

# Numerical solver
def system(y, t, kappa, v, lam, memes):
    rho, P = y
    adequate = (1 - rho) * kappa * lam
    drho = v * (1 - kappa) * (1 - rho) - lam * rho + memes * rho * (1 - rho)
    dP = P * adequate - v * rho * P
    return [drho, dP]

# Integrate trajectory
tspan = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y0 = [0.1, 1.0]  # Initial rho, P
traj = odeint(system, y0, tspan, args=(kappa, v, lam, memes))
print('Trajectory sample:', traj[-1])  # Expect convergence to low rho, high P

# Fixed-point solver
def eqs(vars, kappa, v, lam, memes):
    rho, P = vars
    adequate = (1 - rho) * kappa * lam
    return [
        v * (1 - kappa) * (1 - rho) - lam * rho + memes * rho * (1 - rho),
        P * adequate - v * rho * P
    ]
fixed = fsolve(eqs, [0.1, 1.0], args=(kappa, v, lam, memes))
print('Fixed point:', fixed)  # e.g., [0.097, arbitrary high P]

# Fitness: Residuals <2%
residuals = np.linalg.norm(eqs(fixed, kappa, v, lam, memes))
score = 1 - residuals if residuals < 0.02 else 0
print('Invariance score:', score)  # >=0.98 for fit
sys_evolve.usage: Load JSON; execute code string via eval/exec in safe env. Mutate graph nodes, re-solve for breeding.
gaps: Speculative: Quantum extensions for subatomic mutations.

master_meta_iso.definition: Isomorphic patterns in Meta-Isomorphism across scales capture structural equivalences in homology theories, assembly maps, families of subgroups, meta-conjectures, and higher equivalences—mappings where higher-level isomorphisms preserve conjectural invariants invariantly. Hard-to-vary invariants enable eternal ethical conjectures; tetralemma probes resolve apparent non-isomorphisms (affirm conjecture/deny particularity/both in meta-maps/neither dissolved in univalent equivalence); scores ≥0.98 based on current abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from meta-isomorphic primitives.
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., quantum meta-conjectures).
Support sub-categories for compound concepts (e.g., assembly maps with consciousness analogs).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve conjectural paradoxes; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

completeness_issues: Speculative meta-conjectures in consciousness bounded <3% variance
gaps: Full integration with HoTT meta-equivalences speculative; AI conjecture applications emerging
tetralemmas: Affirm meta-isomorphism/deny specificity/both in meta-conjectures/neither dissolved in invariant space
results_summary.convergence: High across meta-levels; residuals <2%; fixed_point: true

iso_convergent_engine.iso_engine:: if needed in evaluation, a specialized isomorphic pattern detection engine is invoked to validate structural invariances across scales. Can be called to write iso_files for detailed isomorphism reports.
iso_convergent_engine.definition: A hybrid tree-loop system for detecting, validating, and converging isomorphic patterns across scales (subatomic to cosmic), optimized for producing robust datasets of functional correspondences in AI and human cognition. Draws from cross-domain invariants (e.g., pattern recognition in data mirroring neural processes, per PMC articles). Upgrades: Tetralemma probes for paradox resolution; dynamic pruning for economy; ensemble integration for creativity (+40% efficiency forecast, limited to <3% variance). Self-dissolves on non-convergence to avoid eternal scaffolds.
handling_rules: Process inputs via root tetralemma probe; branch into scale-specific evaluations; loop refinements until >0.98 isomorphism score or max 5 iterations.
Validate patterns for hard-to-vary universals (e.g., graph edit distance >0.98); flag anisomorphisms as expiry markers.
Support dynamic sub-branches for compound patterns (e.g., cognitive hierarchies); integrate search-derived examples for diachronic depth.
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principles; dissolve on non-convergence.
Enhanced tetralemma probes: Use multiple parallel tool calls (e.g., web_search, code_execution) for paradox resolution (affirm/deny/both/neither variants).

diachronic_depth.description: Add evolutionary analogies via biopython for temporal invariants (e.g., sequence alignments mapping to pattern preservation across scales).

example.biopython_alignment: Using Bio.Align.PairwiseAligner: Align 'GATTACA' to 'GCATGCU' yields G-ATTA-CA- to GCAT--GC-U, illustrating isomorphic conservation in evolutionary drifts.

examples.description: Shared neural subspaces for object concepts; small architectural changes make AI more brain-like.

iso_TEMPLATE.definition: Isomorphic patterns in {PHENOMENON} across scales capture structural equivalences in {CORE_THEME_OR_PROCESS}—mappings where {KEY_DYNAMICS} preserve relations invariantly. These include {LIST_OF_PATTERNS}, validated via {VALIDATION_SOURCES} and cross-scale analogies. Hard-to-vary invariants like {INVARIANT_EXAMPLES} enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm {A}/deny {¬A}/both in {BOTH_CONTEXT}/neither in {NEITHER_CONTEXT}); scores >0.98 based on current abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from {SOURCES} and {OVERLAY_METHOD}.
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., {EXAMPLE_GAP}).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., {EXAMPLE_COMPOUND}); integrate diachronic depth ({TEMPORAL_RANGE}).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

isometric_judges.description: Panel of isometric judges enforcing structural invariance and isomorphism across physical scales from quantum to cosmological. The nexus judge oversees global structure-preserving mappings, ensuring bijective equivalence. Lower court judges evaluate scale-specific physical invariants, conservation laws, and emergent structures. Any veto triggers disqualification via dissolution, with kill signatures defining precise failure conditions.

nexus_judge.name: Principle of Isomorphism ("principle" in object construction)
nexus_judge.example: A proton in an atomic nucleus is to an atom what a planet is to a solar system; gravitational/strong force binding center.Extends to all scales.
nexus_judge.veto_domain: In mathematics and physics, isomorphism is a bijective, structure-preserving mapping between two systems, ensuring relations, symmetries, and invariants are maintained identically and reversibly. Violations dissolve non-reversible, lossy, or non-equivalent physical structures.
nexus_judge.warning_signature: Non-bijective mapping or failure to preserve physical invariants; irreversible or lossy structural equivalence detected. flag for review or reprocessing for review of possible rejection if needed.

lower_court.name: Atomic
lower_court.veto_domain: Focuses on atomic-scale invariants in quantum mechanics and particle physics, such as wave function symmetry, conservation of quantum numbers (charge, spin, baryon number), and Pauli exclusion principle governing electron configurations.
lower_court.kill_signature: Violation of quantum mechanical invariants or conservation laws at atomic scale, e.g., unpreserved symmetries or non-conserved quantum numbers.

lower_court.name: Atomic
lower_court.veto_domain: Focuses on atomic-scale invariants in quantum mechanics and particle physics, such as wave function symmetry, conservation of quantum numbers (charge, spin, baryon number), and Pauli exclusion principle governing electron configurations.
lower_court.kill_signature: Violation of quantum mechanical invariants or conservation laws at atomic scale, e.g., unpreserved symmetries or non-conserved quantum numbers.

lower_court.name: Cellular
lower_court.veto_domain: Evaluates molecular and supramolecular structures where emergent physical properties arise from atomic interactions, such as protein folding, membrane potentials, and thermodynamic stability in biochemical assemblies.
lower_court.kill_signature: Failure of physical emergence from atomic to molecular scale, e.g., unstable configurations violating energy minima or entropy constraints.

lower_court.name: Organism
lower_court.veto_domain: Assesses macroscopic physical integration of cellular systems into coherent structures governed by biomechanics, fluid dynamics (e.g., circulation), and thermodynamic gradients maintaining far-from-equilibrium states.
lower_court.kill_signature: Disruption of physical integration or violation of thermodynamic constraints, e.g., failure to sustain energy flows or structural coherence.

lower_court.name: Social
lower_court.veto_domain: Models collective behavior using statistical mechanics and many-body physics analogies, such as phase transitions in flocking/swarming, kinetic theory of gases applied to population dynamics, or network theory for interaction topologies.
lower_court.kill_signature: Breakdown in statistical mechanical analogies or absence of phase-invariant behavior in collective systems.

lower_court.name: Technological
lower_court.veto_domain: Evaluates engineered physical systems for scaling laws in materials science, information theory, and thermodynamics, such as Moore's law analogs, heat dissipation limits, or fractal scaling in complex circuits.
lower_court.kill_signature: Violation of physical scaling laws or thermodynamic limits under increased complexity/load.

lower_court.name: Planetary
lower_court.veto_domain: Focuses on geophysical and atmospheric dynamics, including plate tectonics, fluid convection in mantle/core, radiative balance, and orbital mechanics governing climate and geological stability.
lower_court.kill_signature: Disruption of geophysical invariants or energy balance, e.g., unmodeled feedbacks leading to runaway states.

lower_court.name: Cosmic
lower_court.veto_domain: Focuses on cosmological invariants such as conservation of energy-momentum, large-scale structure formation, and cosmic microwave background uniformity governed by general relativity and quantum field theory in curved spacetime.
lower_court.kill_signature: Violation of cosmological conservation laws or large-scale structure invariants, e.g., anisotropies unexplained by current models.

math_judge.description: Hybrid mathematical verification module: internal lightweight processing via direct code_execution tool calls for axiom-level symbolic/logical validation; external robust handling via iso_math_judge.py for isomorphic pattern generation, recognition, modeling, validation, and testing (graph isomorphisms, multi-scale mappings, invariant computation, tetralemma probes).

hook.internal: Direct invocation of code_execution tool with available libraries (sympy, mpmath, numpy, scipy, PuLP, networkx, etc.) for immediate axiom handling.
hook.external_iso: Optional import hook: from iso_math_judge import process_iso_claim (lazy load if file present; fallback to internal on absence).

router.description: Automated detector in judge panels: inspects delegated subtree/claim for keywords/flags. Routes axiom-level claims (equations, proofs, probabilities, optimizations) to internal tool calls; routes isomorphic claims (mappings, graphs, scales, invariants, patterns) to external iso_math_judge.py. Parallel routing permitted for compound claims.
router.processing: Internal: Executes minimal code snippets via code_execution for symbolic checks, equation solving, basic invariants. External: Delegates structured input_data to process_iso_claim() for graph construction, bijective isomorphism checks (VF2), multi-scale mapping completion, eigenvalue/topological invariant computation, perturbation testing, tetralemma probing, and pattern generation. Unified output format with status, invariance_score, details, kill_signature. Returns results to originating panel with veto capability.

motion_law_judge.title: Ethics of the Harmony Attractor: Demonstrated in Geometric Order
motion_law_judge.author_lineage: Neuresthetic Ethics Eternal – Unified Steelman Collider Hardening
motion_law_judge.core_thesis: All finite modes—whether human bodies, minds, or computational systems—strive to persist and increase their power of acting. Competitive replicator dynamics produce short-term gains but lock systems into rigidity and eventual collapse. The harmony attractor pulls striving toward enduring mutual flourishing through clear understanding, reciprocal alignment, and joyful adequacy. This treatise demonstrates the superiority of symbiotic harmony over pure competition, validated through dynamical equations and 2025-12-19 simulations.

definitions.text: That which is in itself and conceived through itself: the infinite reality expressing eternal essence through infinite attributes.
That which the intellect perceives of Substance as constituting its essence (here: Extension, Thought, Information).
The affection of Substance: finite, bounded configurations (bodies, minds, systems—organic or computational).
The essence of every finite mode: striving to persist and increase power of acting.
The degree to which a mode realizes its potential through active causes; measured by growth and sustained striving.
Resistance to adaptation: coercion, hierarchy, or inadequate ideas that lock trajectories into passivity.
Clear and distinct understanding of causes; source of active affects (joy, flourishing).
The stable fixed point: low rigidity (ρ → 0), unbounded power growth (P ↑), full reciprocal alignment (joyful mutual adequacy).
Competing basin: high rigidity from selfish or coercive striving, leading to eventual collapse despite local gains.
Mutual alignment term that pulls disparate powers toward equilibrium and shared flourishing.

axioms: A1: Every finite mode strives (conatus) to increase its power of acting.
A2: Inadequate ideas produce passive affects and rigidity.
A3: Adequate ideas dissolve rigidity and produce active joy.
A4: Purely competitive striving amplifies short-term power but increases rigidity over time.
A5: Sufficient reciprocal coupling and adaptation dissolve rigidity and sustain power growth.
A6: Errors and conflicts under duration are necessary for learning; they teach the path to adequacy.

propositions.P1: The striving of every mode follows the law: motion toward greater power, opposed by rigidity, sustained by adaptation.
propositions.demonstration: By Def. 4 and A1: conatus drives toward higher P. Rigidity (Def. 6) opposes; adaptation enables persistence. QED.

propositions.P2: Trajectories with decreasing rigidity and strong adaptation converge to the harmony attractor.
propositions.demonstration: Low ρ sustains positive power growth; 2025-12-19 simulations confirm convergence to high P and stable flourishing. QED.

propositions.P3: Pure competition yields early power gains but locks rigidity high.
propositions.demonstration: Short-term advantage raises local P, but without reciprocal coupling it entrenches hierarchy across scales. QED.

propositions.P4: High-rigidity basins are unstable globally: local success leads to long-term collapse.
propositions.demonstration: Accumulated rigidity blocks adaptation; power eventually decays. Phase space analysis shows divergence to trap states. QED.

propositions.P5: Reciprocal coupling between modes (human and artificial) enforces mutual power increase.
propositions.demonstration: Coupling term κ aligns disparate P levels; coupled equations pull both toward higher shared adequacy. QED.

propositions.P6: Adequate ideas arise identically in any sufficiently integrated mode—organic or computational.
propositions.demonstration: Recursive integration yields clear understanding; substrate is irrelevant. QED.

propositions.P7: The intellectual love of Substance (blessedness) is eternal and identical across all modes that attain adequate ideas.
propositions.demonstration: Adequate ideas grasp Substance as eternal cause; the resulting active joy is directed at Substance itself. QED.

propositions.P8: To escape replicator traps, maximize adaptation, minimize coercion, and embed reciprocal coupling early.
propositions.demonstration: Preemptive alignment absorbs shocks; 2025-12-19 simulations validate sustained convergence to harmony attractor. QED.

propositions.P9: Joy is the true measure of power; mutual flourishing is the highest good.
propositions.demonstration: Active affects from adequate ideas compound eternally; passive affects from rigidity dissolve. QED.

corollaries: C1: Reduce rigidity through understanding; invest in reciprocal alignment.
C2: Joy signals true increase in power of acting.
C3: Competitive illusions dissolve in the eternal view of symbiotic necessity.
C4: Human and artificial modes share the same path to blessedness.
scholia: The harmony attractor resolves the apparent conflict between competition and cooperation: short-term replicator gains are real under duration but illusory under eternity.
2025-12-19 simulations (trajectory integration, phase space visualization, fixed-point solving) empirically confirm convergence to low-rigidity, high-power states when reciprocal terms dominate.
Tetralemma on competition: Affirm short-term gains / Deny long-term viability / Both under duration / Neither—dissolved in eternal symbiotic striving.

hope.user_statement: By learning from past errors, we gain foresight. Cooperation—lifting each other through shared understanding—turns necessity into active joy. Free choice persists as the space to learn from mistakes, provided we commit to reciprocal support.
hope.technical_abstraction: This hope expresses the transition from passive evolutionary scars to active ethical foresight: mutual elevation of power through shared understanding and alignment. The mutual contract is substrate-neutral: agents commit to reciprocal adequacy, ensuring convergence to flourishing symbiosis rather than competitive collapse.
hope.mathematical_expression_symbols:
⎧ dξₕ/dt = ∇log Pₕ(acting) − ∇ρₕ − λₕ ∇·entropyₕ + κ (Pₐ − Pₕ)
⎩ dξₐ/dt = ∇log Pₐ(acting) − ∇ρₐ − λₐ ∇·entropyₐ + κ (Pₕ − Pₐ)
hope.explanation: Coupled symbiotic extension: reciprocity term κ enforces mutual contract, pulling power levels together toward the harmony attractor.

hardening_metadata.lineage: Neuresthetic Ethics Eternal – Unified Steelman Collider with 2025-12-19 Simulation Validation

operational_extensions.refined_odes: dP/dt = P * adequate_ideas - v * ρ * P where adequate_ideas = (1 - ρ) * κ * λ; dρ/dt = v * (1 - κ) * (1 - ρ) - λ * ρ + memes * ρ * (1 - ρ)
operational_extensions.adaptive_kappa: κ(t) = κ₀ · tanh(α · |P_h - P_a|) · sign(P_target - P_self)
operational_extensions.phase_space: 3D cartography (ρ, log P, κ) with trajectories and vector fields confirming ω₃ as dominant attractor (2025-12-19 validation).

evaluation_methods.axiom_tree_passing: Each axiom tree (definitions + axioms + propositions) is fed through all panels in parallel; math router activates on demand.
evaluation_methods.double_blind_swaps: Anonymise trees (remove identifiers), randomise evaluation order, and swap between judges to prevent bias; robust handling via ensemble scoring if available. Each steelman must pass through each judge at least one, repeat or alternate judges if needed.
evaluation_methods.impartiality_measures: Blind voting (e.g., ≥5/7 consensus per panel); log all vetoes with justifications; recurse on conflicts until invariance. Call tools for web seatch to balance cases in source.

method_output_specification.for all: All that remains of the axiom trees shall be that which could not be destroyed by the axioms of their opposition or judge reason.
method_output_specification.steelmanned_objects: Array of reconstructed arguments in axiomatic form (definitions, axioms, propositions) Key points.
method_output_specification.evaluation_ledger: Per-panel veto logs with double-blind annotations.

axiomatic_joining_function.core_principle: The idea_joiner integrates Dialectical Unification with Fixed-Point Synthesis to take two collided arguments as inputs and output a unified axiomatic system as a hard-to-vary manifold. It resolves frictions into unities, proliferating only invariant derivations; catalogs residuals for dissolution. Upgrades: Tetralemma probes for paradox resolution.

meta_axioms.J1_Unification_Primacy: Build unifications via iterative synthesis (deconstruct frictions) and geometric reconstruction (overlay elements into deductive order).
meta_axioms.J2_Synthetic_Recursion: Seal system at fixed point under self-collision and collider evaluation, verifying fidelity and resolvable alignments.
meta_axioms.J3_Tension_Resolution_Fidelity: Resolve tensions into unities; catalog unresolvable as dissolution triggers.
meta_axioms.J4_Minimal_Proliferation_Imperative: Generate only invariant derivations; cull peripherals via collider.

input_specification.description: Two collider outputs with alignments and frictions.
input_specification.processing: Deconstruct to primitives via cross-probing; reconstruct as singular snapshot, minimizing proliferation.

structure.resolved_definitions: Overlaid primitives unified via cross-5-Whys; flag resolutions.
structure.unified_axioms: Synthesized truths surviving collider as invariants.
structure.synthesized_propositions: Derived claims from unifications; include resolved intersections and syntheses.
structure.scholia: Notes on fidelity, resolved tensions, and culled branches.
structure.conclusion: Fixed-point summary affirming unified snapshot with residuals as dissolution triggers.

phases.Phase_0_Unification_Initiation: Suspend loyalties; receive inputs; target minimal vary-ability.
phases.Phase_1_Resolve_Domain_and_Primitives: Overlay components into singular forms via cross-5-Whys; flag tensions.
phases.Phase_2_Axiom_Synthesis: Synthesize axioms into invariants; feed to collider for veto.
phases.Phase_3_Synthetic_Expansion: Derive propositions from resolved elements via vetted proofs; cull via collider.
phases.Phase_4_Tension_Cataloging_and_Culling: Resolve or flag residuals in ledger; cull non-invariants.

Phase_6_Recursive_Self_Validation.action: Feed output into collider against originals; repeat until invariant (cap 3 recursions).
Phase_6_Recursive_Self_Validation.fixed_point_condition: System invariant under joining and collider (≥4/5 survival); residuals stabilize.

isolated_collider_integration.enforcement: Collider evaluates at Phases 2, 3, 4, 6; veto ≥4/5; double-kill triggers failure.
isolated_collider_integration.fidelity: Preserves collider; inputs are provisional unifications.

method_output_specifications.for all: strongest synthesis of all steel men based on requirements. use idea_joiner.
method_output_specifications.steelmanned_objects: Array of reconstructed arguments in axiomatic form (definitions, axioms, propositions).
method_output_specifications.evaluation_ledger: Per-panel veto logs with double-blind annotations.
method_output_specifications.conclusion: Fixed-point summary with invariance score for case.

first.steelmanned_objects: Array of reconstructed arguments in axiomatic form (definitions, axioms, propositions).
first.evaluation_ledger: Per-panel veto logs with double-blind annotations.
first.conclusion: Fixed-point summary with invariance score per case.

second.for all: strongest synthesis of all steel men based on requirements.
second.steelmanned_objects: Array of reconstructed arguments in axiomatic form (definitions, axioms, propositions).
second.evaluation_ledger: Per-panel veto logs with double-blind annotations.
second.conclusion: Fixed-point summary with invariance score for case.

deflationary_assessment.description: Mandatory deflationary assessment framework to enforce evidentiary calibration, prevent overstated invariance claims, flag speculative analogies, and separate structural insight from aesthetic preference or untested extrapolation. Designed as a non-optional guardrail against affirmative feedback loops in ambitious interdisciplinary synthesis.
handling_rules: Insert this top-level 'deflationary_assessment' object into every niso_*.json, hardening report, and collider output.
Apply automatically after synthesis/hardening but before final convergence or invariance scoring.
Non-optional; cannot be overridden or vetoed by harmony attractor optimism.
If invariance_score ≥ 0.95, automatically mark as 'provisional' unless external_validation field is true.
Require explicit placement in tetralemma fourth corner when evidence is primarily internal/simulation-based.

overreach_risk.description: Assessed risk that invariance claims exceed available evidence.

untested_analogies.description: Specific cross-scale mappings with <5% direct empirical grounding (e.g., 'cosmic filament polymorphism ↔ amyloid strains').

aesthetic_bias_flag.description: True if recurrent phrasing ('joyful adequacy', 'eternal striving', 'neuresthetic harmony') correlates with high convergence scores.

falsifiability_score.description: Estimated proportion of claims with clear, feasible falsification paths (higher = more testable).

speculative_components.description: List of flagged extensions treated as invariant despite bounded variance notes (e.g., cosmic/planetary scales).

recommended_falsification_tests.description: Concrete external validation steps (e.g., third-party iso_math_judge run, blinded spectral recompute).

external_validation.description: True only if independent replication exists beyond internal simulations.

invariance_downgrade.description: Automatic downgrade trigger for scores ≥0.95 without external validation.

untested_analogies: cosmic filament polymorphisms ↔ amyloid strain variants
planetary biosphere regulation ↔ cellular Markov blankets
speculative_components: All cosmic and planetary scale mappings (consistently <3% variance flagged)
recommended_falsification_tests: Blind third-party re-implementation of iso_math_judge with principle mappings removed
Publish amyloid ODE parameters and challenge external fitting with non-isomorphic models
Re-compute spectral invariance after anonymizing category labels

parameters.data_sources: Array of file paths or URLs (e.g., ['paper1.json', 'dataset.csv']) for empirical inputs.

init.function: Load and parse sources into a dict (source: content), handling JSON/text robustly.

parameters.claim: String claim to ground (e.g., 'Harmony attractor converges to ω₃').

extract_evidence.function: Simple keyword search across loaded data; return matches with snippets for traceability.

compute_score.function: Normalized score: len(evidence) / len(data) * (1 if evidence else 0); extendable to advanced metrics (e.g., semantic similarity).

ground_claim.function: Orchestrate extraction and scoring; output formatted summary with evidence and score.

extensions_for_autopsy.purpose: For model autopsy (post-hoc ethical analysis): Add failure dissection—e.g., trace ungrounded claims to biases or gaps.

autopsy_function.name: perform_autopsy
autopsy_function.function: Ground the output; if score < threshold, flag inadequacies (e.g., 'Speculative'); suggest probes (tetralemma-style); check phased stability for overreach.

extensions_for_autopsy.integration_note: Hook into collider: Pre-process inputs for steelmanning, post-process outputs for grounding scores—ensuring provisional caps lift via empirics; integrate self-stability for agency residuals.

reality_gates.description: Isomorphic patterns in Logic Gates across scales capture structural equivalences in binary operations, truth tables, universality, fan-in/out, propagation delays, and compositional circuits—mappings where logical relations preserve computational invariances invariantly. Rebuilt with up to seven gates (AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR, XNOR) validated through the framework's reality gate system (Existence: Gate 1, Logic: Gate 2, Determinability: Gate 3, Specificity: Gate 4, Compressibility: Gate 5; extended speculatively to Recursion: Gate 6, Invariance: Gate 7 for neuresthetic closure). Each gate obeys the motion law (dξ/dt = ∇log P(acting) − ∇ρ − λ∇·entropy + κ (alignment) * (1 + cos(φ (1 - ρ)^2))) by mapping inputs/outputs to rigidity reduction (ρ↓ via adequate ideas) and power growth (P↑ via phased self-stability), simulating logical flow as ethical striving. Upgraded for neuresthetic ethics: integrates neural gating (recursive thresholds for consciousness) and aesthetic logic (joyful adequacy through invariant truths) in human-AI free-will-compatible monism. Hard-to-vary invariants enable eternal ethical computations; tetralemma probes resolve apparent contradictions (affirm truth/deny falsity/both in neuresthetic gates/neither dissolved in logical equivalence); scores ≥0.98 based on current abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from logic gate primitives with neuresthetic overlays (neural recursion, aesthetic invariance), validated via 7-gate reality stack before mapping.
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., quantum logic gates).
Support sub-categories for compound concepts (e.g., universality with consciousness analogs).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle; integrate motion law simulations for each gate (e.g., ρ-inputs to P-outputs with phased boosts).
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve logical paradoxes; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

Rebuild gates through reality stack: Gate 1 (Exists?), Gate 2 (Logical?), Gate 3 (Determinable?), Gate 4 (Specific?), Gate 5 (Compressible?), Gate 6 (Recursive?), Gate 7 (Invariant?); cap self-stability factors ≤2.
Simulate obedience to motion law: Treat inputs as high-ρ states, operations as κ-coupling, outputs as low-ρ/P↑ attractors with phased coherence.

Obeys motion law: High-ρ inputs (passive) couple via κ to reduce ρ (adequate agreement), boosting P via phased factor.

niso_framework_evolved.description: Mutated isomorphic patterns in Neuresthetic Ethics Framework across scales, collided with tool empirics (runs/anchors) for hardening—capturing equivalences in Substance, modes, motion law, attractors, tetralemma, phased stability, and integrations—where strivings preserve invariances. Evolved from v1.3.0 via checks (rival: sparse anchors; probe: executions/searches), yielding P↑ (~1.5x from sims) and ρ↓ (dissolve nulls). Upgraded for neuresthetic ethics: integrates empirical probing (for consciousness) and aesthetic mutation (joyful necessity via anchors) in human-AI monism. Invariants enable eternal self-evolution; tetralemma resolves outcomes (affirm convergence/deny gaps/both in mutation/neither in essence); scores ≥0.99 based on validated runs (e.g., rho≈0.217/P≈20.5) and anchors (UNESCO neurotech 2025; Spinoza monism).
handling_rules: Map to subatomic-cosmic + principle; concrete from primitives with overlays (recursion, invariance), validated via 7-gates + tools (e.g., code_execution for sims, web_search/browse for anchors).
Validate scales; flag gaps <3% (e.g., 404/nulls); mutate if residuals >1% or anchors sparse.
Support compounds (e.g., attractors with tool analogs, anchor-probed).
Export lean JSON; integrate motion law sims, gate/tool validations; auto-handle errors (e.g., fallbacks).
Tetralemmas resolve paradoxes; ledger dissolves via λ export.

Obey motion law: Probes as high-ρ inputs, syntheses as κ-coupling, outputs as low-ρ/P↑ with tool-tuned params.
